contentrichtext.text: {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image=[[Image:Ins mumbai-Fremantle-2001.jpg|300px|INS Mumbai]] |Ship caption=INS ''Mumbai'' at Fremantle, Western Australia }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag={{shipboxflag|India|naval}} |Ship name=INS ''Mumbai'' |Ship namesake=[[Mumbai]] |Ship owner= |Ship operator= |Ship registry= |Ship route= |Ship ordered=20 March 1992 |Ship awarded= |Ship builder=[[Mazagon Dock Limited]], {{flag|India}} |Ship original cost= |Ship yard number= |Ship way number= |Ship laid down=12 December 1992 |Ship launched=20 March 1995 |Ship sponsor= |Ship christened= |Ship completed= |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned=22 January 2001 |Ship recommissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship maiden voyage= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship renamed= |Ship reclassified= |Ship refit= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport= |Ship identification= |Ship motto="''Aham Prayptam Tvidametesam Balam''" (''I am Invincible'') |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship honors= |Ship captured= |Ship fate=Active |Ship status= |Ship notes= |Ship badge=[[Image:Mumbai logo small.jpg|150px|center|Seal of INS ''Mumbai'']] }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class=[[Delhi class destroyer|''Delhi''-class ]]destroyer |Ship type= |Ship tonnage= |Ship displacement= 6,200 tons (full load)<ref name=in-destroyers>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiannavy.nic.in/destroyers.htm |title=Surface Ships |publisher=Indian Navy |date= |accessdate=2010-12-07}}</ref> |Ship tons burthen= |Ship length={{convert|163|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|17|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship height= |Ship draught={{convert|6.5|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= |Ship depth= |Ship hold depth= |Ship decks= |Ship deck clearance= |Ship ramps= |Ship ice class= |Ship power= |Ship propulsion= 2 M36E gas turbines; 2 x AM-50 boost gas turbines; 54,000 shp<br> 2 x cruise diesels; 2 shafts, 10,000 bhp<ref name=br-delhi>[http://www.bharat-rakshak.com/NAVY/Delhi.html ]{{dead link|date=December 2010}}</ref> |Ship sail plan= |Ship speed={{convert|32|kn|km/h}}+ |Ship range={{convert|5000|mi|km|abbr=on}} |Ship endurance= |Ship test depth= |Ship boats= |Ship capacity= |Ship troops= |Ship complement= 360 (Including 40 officers) |Ship crew= |Ship time to activate= |Ship sensors= ''Air Surveillance;'' 1 x MR-775 Fregat MAE (NATO: Half Plate) planar array radar (with SRA-01 IFF equipment)<br>''Surface Surveillance;'' 1 x Bharat RAWL (Dutch Signaal LW08) radar, operating at D-band frequency<br>''Navigation;'' 3 x MR-212/201 navigation radars, operating at I-band, JRC SATCOM (cylindrical)<br>''Sonar;'' 1 x Thales ATAS sonar system and 1 x Bharat HUMSA sonar system |Ship EW= |Ship armament=16 x SS-N-25 SSM (4 quad launchers),<br />2 x SA-N-7 SAM launchers,<br />1 x 100mm AK-100 gun,<br /> 4 x 30mm AK-630 gatling guns,<br />2 x [[RBU-6000]] Anti-submarine mortars,<br /> 5 x 10-21 inch torpedo tubes |Ship armour= |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft=2 x [[Westland Sea King|Sea King]] helicopters |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |} The '''INS ''Mumbai'' (D62)''' is the third of the [[Delhi class destroyer|''Delhi''-class]] [[guided-missile destroyer]]s in active-service with the [[Indian Navy]]. ''Mumbai'' was built at [[Mazagon Dock Limited]] in her namesake city [[Mumbai]], launched in 1995, and commissioned in 2001. The ship's crest depicts the gateway entrance to [[List of Indian Navy bases in Mumbai|INS Angre]] (named as such in honour of Admiral [[Kanhoji Angre]]). The gateway has a watch tower with three look-out posts and stands against the backdrop of the ramparts of the fort. Two Ghurabs (or Grabs), depicted on either side of the fort, signify the seafaring traditions of the [[Marathas]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bharat-rakshak.com/NAVY/Articles/Article14.html |title=INS Mumbai: A Photo Essay |publisher=Bharat-rakshak.com |date= |accessdate=2010-12-07}}</ref> ==Operations== [[File:SeaKing Mk42B Indian Navy 2005.JPG|thumb|left|Sea King assigned to the Indian naval destroyer [[INS Mumbai|INS ''Mumbai'']].]] ===Operation Sukoon=== In July 2006, INS ''Mumbai'' was part of '''Task Force 54''', on its way back to India from the [[Mediterranean]], when [[2006 Israel-Lebanon conflict|Israel-Lebanon conflict]] broke out. ''Mumbai'' was redeployed to assist the evacuation of Indian citizens from [[Lebanon]] as a part of [[Operation Sukoon]].<ref>{{cite news |url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/5191366.stm |date = 2006-07-21 |title = Indians arrive home from Lebanon |accessdate = 2006-07-21 |publisher = BBC News}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} <!-- non-breaking space to keep AWB drones from altering the space before the navbox--> {{Delhi class destroyers}} {{Ship classes of the Indian Navy}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mumbai (D62)}} [[Category:Delhi-class destroyers]] [[Category:Ships built in India]] [[Category:1995 ships]] [[Category:Active destroyers of India]] {{mil-ship-stub}}
